subject: Cable for steeringwheel
description_text:
Hello, recently i have had some trouble with the cable that came with the
gt2 wheel. It has been disconnecting and reconnecting when the cable has
ben twisted or bent during normal use on a moza r9. i bought the wheel used
so i dont know how old it is but i would like to know if its possible to
just buy a new cable?
except the cable i love the wheel, and the quality of it:)
Best regards

conversations.body_text: Hi bror mehl, please provide your order number.

I do not have an order number due to the fact that i bought the wheel used,
it is a simsonn gt2 wheel

fre. 26. des. 2025 kl. 06:51 skrev service@simsonn.com <service@simsonn.com
>:

> Hi bror mehl, please provide your order number.
>
>
>
>
Hi bror mehl,  The issue might be caused by a loose cable. Please provide your contact name, phone number, and shipping address. We will assess the shipping cost and send you a replacement USB cable.

Hello

My contact name is Bror Mehl Winge
Phone number: +47 465 19 078
Shipping adress: Haukåsvegen 82, 5912 Seim, in Norway

søn. 28. des. 2025 kl. 04:14 skrev service@simsonn.com <service@simsonn.com
>:

> Hi bror mehl,
>
> The issue might be caused by a loose cable. Please provide your contact
> name, phone number, and shipping address. We will assess the shipping cost
> and send you a replacement USB cable.
>
>
>
Hi bror mehl,  Please provide your order number.

Hi, i have not gotten an order number, i was told to provide my contact
name, adress and phone number so that i could be sent a replacement cable

søn. 4. jan. 2026 kl. 02:36 skrev service@simsonn.com
Hi bror mehl,  May I ask which platform you purchased this from? Please provide a screenshot of the purchase so we can verify the order details.

I purchased it used from finn.no which is a norwegian website for selling
used items


ons. 7. jan. 2026 kl. 16:19 skrev service@simsonn.com

Hi bror mehl,  Can you please confirm that the issue is caused by a damaged data cable? Please note that even if we send you a replacement cable, it may not necessarily solve the issue, as there have been wiring order changes in different batches of steering wheel cables. At the moment, I’m not sure which wiring order your cable uses. To help us verify this accurately, could you please remove the screws at the connector, take a clear photo of the soldering/wiring order, and send it to us for confirmation?

Hello,

I currently dont have acces to the cable but i will send a picture of it as
soon as possible, it will probably be tuesday next week :)

tor. 8. jan. 2026 kl. 03:26 skrev service@simsonn.com

This is the soldering order, sorry for the bad pictures
Black and red cable
Red and White cable
White and Green cable

Green and black cable
